result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrey Junior Aponte was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Flee Or Elude An Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Provide DNA sample.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of  Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined.

timeConds.notes:
Report in 7/6/2022 by 5:00 p.m.
Huber for work.
Perform 30 hours of community service at a nonprofit charitable organization.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrey Junior Aponte

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Andrey Junior Aponte in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 36 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 4 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS.  

The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 30 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Serve 5 MONTHS in the House of Correction with HUBER for work. REPORT IN BY: 7-6-2022 5:00PM
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide DNA Sample. 
AODA and other counseling needs to be determined.
Seek and maintain full-time employment.
Perform 30 hours of community service at a non-profit charitable organization.
No driving without valid license. 
Complete Driver safety course. 

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he/she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Sentencing hearing on June 30, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Andrey Junior Aponte in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for Plea/sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by defense counsel and defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire and jury instruction received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint/Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record. 

The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    
Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing, Branch 38.

e-FILED: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights; filed.

Defendant Andrey Junior Aponte in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and offer and request case set for plea and sentencing hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Andrey Junior Aponte in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle; both appear in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No driving without a valid license.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Andrey Junior Aponte in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
